title: CPR Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Dade City, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Excellent, very professional and hospitable. Appreciated every aspect of the process and the onboarding. Everyone was very friendly and helpful Excellent, very professional and hospitable. Appreciated every aspect of the process and the onboarding. Everyone was very friendly and helpful
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you helped someone

title: Lead Lvn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview and virtual interview with different hiring managers and staff employees. Asked to describe times you have been in certain situations and what you did in those situations. They asked for well rounded answers to all questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a conflict with another employee and how you resolved it?

title: IR Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health (Tampa, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Went to an interview after applying on indeed, and explained my experience; too to bottom and it was very typical, basic questions. The only extra thing was that they asked something they should know about me.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you would like us to know about you?

title: ER Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Overall the interview process was moderately hard. I was scheduled for an interview with the ED manager and director. The director was the only one to ask questions and solely focused on case study/scenario-based questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. A patient is coming from a convalescent home altered, febrile, and hypotensive. What diagnosis would you suspect? For a septic patient, what medication and orders could you expect? For a septic patient, how would you give report to an ICU nurse?

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Tampa, FL) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter calls and sets everything up then will contact you with an offer if one is made. After that everything is done through Employee health. The whole process takes about 2-3 weeks to complete.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience have you had?

title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (New Smyrna, FL) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: My interview process was easy and simple. I felt welcomed by the manager. I felt very much at ease . The interview was not very long at all. Also I had difficulty with the zoom portion of it and they were very understanding of the difficulty and agreed to speak to me over the phone.
Interview Questions: What did I know about Advent Health and to tell them about myself.

title: Physician Compensation Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy and conversational. The recruitment screener was nice and answered all questions. They seem to be a very employer as she was there for 8 years. I was not passed to the next step, though.
Interview Questions: What was your previous work experience?

title: Patient Registration Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Bolingbrook, IL)
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty standard interview questions. Tell me about yourself, why did you quit this job, tell me about a time when. The recruiter I spoke with was not very enthusiastic. Promised to get back to me by a certain date, but never did.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, etc.

title: Collector Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: accepted an interview via microsoft teams lasted about an hour my interviewers consists of two very professional supervisors they both ask great question and gave me great detail on what the company was expecting and searching for in this position.
Interview Questions: interview was great i was ask about my previous expeerince as a collector

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Ocala, FL) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was amazing.! The hiring process take a little bit but once you are done with EHS they only took 2 days to provide me with my start day. I love the culture and how they deliver exceptional experience also they talk about extend the healing Ministry of Christ.
Interview Questions: How do you want to improve yourself in the next year?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a lengthy process. I got an interview invitation after submitting an application on line. Was told to do the advent health walk in job interview. Went thru two different managers then was offered a position
Interview Questions: Varies on speciality for your nurse residency

title: RN New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Asked personality and behavior based questions about myself, my future goals, and interested units Also wanted to know why I decided to interview for them Wanted to get a feel for my clinical experience It was a panel based interview, lasted about 30 mins
Interview Questions: What are your short term and long term goals in nursing?

title: RRT/RCP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the website, received an email asking to interview. The interview was easygoing, done through teams online, interviewed with the manager who asked general questions and asked what about adventist health made me want to work there
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the management team and it was a good experience overall. The interviewers provided a tour of the facility at the end. The team members who were around were welcoming.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Adventist Health?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Telephonic interview and send a link to update the details and submit through online for their review and finally a panel of doctors will call for an interview in different sections and different days and evaluate the process.
Interview Questions: About your self ?, Why choose Advent Health

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied on Indeed, and received a same day interview for 12pm that day. Indeed sent the link and gave some reviews. 30 minute interview and other people waiting. Indeed sent them my resume but you do have to dress in a business casual attire in your home.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Adventist Health

title: sr reimbursement analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied and the recruiter said that they liked my resume. I spoke with the recruiter on Thursday and she said she would provide me with feedback by Tuesday. That was over 3 weeks ago. The recruiter ghosted me. This says a lot about the company.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Senior Benefits Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening , virtual interview. The recruiter would call at 4:59 or leave a message after 5 pm to return the call.When you did , she wasn’t available .she would go unresponsive when needing updates. Interview was fine . I was suppose to interview with two managers. One never even showed up. They asked regular questions around experience. The interview itself wasn’t bad but the recruiter did make the experience difficult
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience

title: Nutrition Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Just be confident and show interest! Only asked a few questions and then was shown around. You were tested on your abilities in the kitchen area. For example, the interviewer would intentionally change something on the plate and you would have to notice what that is by reading the patients meal chart. Be attentive!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at adventist?

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Adventist Health (New York, NY) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Basically the interview process is take 10 to 20 minute for overall manner. They may ask questions regard to self introduction, professional working experience and academic qualifications,and so on as well related job position which as applicant apply for.
Interview Questions: Have you legally authoriz to work in US?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: It was very thorough and detailed. Interview via Microsoft Teams with manager and staff nurse. Very nice, professional and made you feel comfortable. They focused on how the unit operates, requirements to do the job and the different units of the hospital for float pool.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for this position?

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fairly easy and quick. Interviewed with the unit manager and they asked basic interview questions and lasted for about 30 minutes. It seems like they were urgently in need of more nurses
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself in 3 to 5 years

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: interviewed on zoom during COVID, it was a relaxed interview with the nurse manager of the department and they asked me the normal interview questions such as - why I see myself working there, what my future goals are, how I resonate with the values of the organization
Interview Questions: How do I resonate with the values at Adventist Health

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Altamonte Spg, FL) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy, the onboarding was quick and easy. I did not have a long wait for Human Resource to contact me the whole process went  smooth the interviewer was thoroughly with her question
Interview Questions: Why did you want to be a nurse

Phone interview. 
Behavioral questions.
No clinical questions. 
Know their missions statement.
Structured. 
Took about 30 minutes. 
Hard harder interviews… but easy for a new grad position.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Silver Spring, MD) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
It was okay. Just the way I expected. “Tell me about yourself question and then behavioral questions.
I answered the tell me about yourself question starting with what I do presently, my education, achievements  and past work experiences.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions using the STAR analysis

title: Supply Chain Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
After applying May 2nd, I heard back in June. 
The phone interviewer had to reschedule three times to speak with me, and we spoke on June 16th. 
I was then to hear back about the first live interview. 
I wrote to explain that there was other interest, and when would the reach me. 
I was then told that the position had been filled which was a surprise to my contact.
Interview Questions: What did their mission statement mean to me?

title: ARNP Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Had to meet a whole afternoon for the interview. It could have been done through zoom since there was no tour involved. But the recruiter was very nice snd so were the other personnel
Interview Questions: Make an occasion when you went over and being your duties

title: New Grad StaRN Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Ocala, FL) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: They had it virtual to where I was the only person with the camera on. The interviewer wasn't even paying attention, I had to repeat myself and she didn't seem prepared with questions to ask me. Seemed as if I was a bother to her. Long and behold I didn't get the job for that unit but I don't think I would have taken it it offered, due to my bad experience.
Interview Questions: 4 patient scenario of what your priority setup would be and interventions.

title: Social Work Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Adventist Health (San Francisco, CA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process. Multiple interviews. It also took a long time to get offer letter. Over all not too bad. They could speed up letting candidates know if they have been choose.
Interview Questions: What are your goals for the future

title: Chaplain Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: It was face to face. Questions were are asked  about the role of a chaplain and would I do if  a certain situation developed in my visit a chaplain. I was also given  information on the hospital and its capacity.
Interview Questions: What would I say the role of a chaplain is?

title: Health and Wellness Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions:
My interview process was stretched out over 5+ months. After being told I would be contacted for a 4th interview, the company changed their mind. 

Side note: The two recruiters I interacted with both left Adventist Health throughout this process.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working at Adventist?

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Refused to discuss salary how the offer works in regards to being a new graduate, not very direct on call or scheduling. Offered insight on shifts available, otherwise a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: How would I handle difficult personalities.

title: Ultrasound Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was through the online platform HireVue where you record your answers to the questions asked, the second was through a video call, and the third scanning interview was in person.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to become an ultrasound tech?

title: Talent Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: After applying, a Hirevue (digital interview) link was sent via email, within a week of completing that, a virtual (and live) interview was scheduled, followed by an in-person interview the following week.
Interview Questions: Experience based questions were asked for all steps.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions:
Phone Interview 
30 mins
clinical questions 
Have good phone energy 
Use Teams to meet virtually 
Meet with manager of the clinic or hospital department 
meet with a current team member
Interview Questions: Describe your last or current workflow in a clinic or hospital setting.

title: Russian Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Pretty nice people, convenient system to apply. Little confusing how to proceed with application, but convenient job search. It took not much time between first and second interview, but I waited for a bit for 3rd interview
Interview Questions:
My experience.
How will I proceed if I am not able to archive my goals

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Orlando, FL) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy. They asked how much experience do I have and what health care positions did I had. I was offered a position on the spot but I declined the offer.
Interview Questions: What type of experience do I have?

title: Referral Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Tehachapi, CA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone call from the manager. They gave me a prescreening. They told me they would like to proceed with a formal interview. Ask me if I was vaccinated but did not be.
Interview Questions: What is my availability?  Am I willing to travel?

title: RN Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Was quick and easy had to do a drug screen and back round check with in two days of accepting the offer. If they need help they pretty much cut to the chase and just go over the basics.
Interview Questions: They ask if I was willing to re locate

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and effortless, very friendly staff. Very polite and the panel asked good questions. Professional, straight forward and overall a good interview. There were three people on the interview panel and each took turns asking questions.
Interview Questions: Give an example you disagreedes with your boss

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: it was a virtual interview. everyone was very kind, they didn't rush you or bombard you with questions. It was a very safe and open environment, no judgement. They gave a scenario and asked what interventions I would do without doc orders, what I thought doc would order, and discharge teaching.
Interview Questions: where I see myself in 3-5 years

title: Desktop Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Hanford, CA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
It was a straight forward interview process. 
Greeted me, went ahead and asked several general questions.
Asked about my experience and education. 
Then I asked them several questions regarding the position.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths and weaknesses?
Give us an example of a challenge in your experience?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Hinsdale, IL) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the unit manager and 1 senior team member. We met in managers office. I was given a tour of the unit. After, I was brought back in and offer was made on site.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in this field

title: Patient Registration Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Sanford, FL) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: This was the first Interview I have done and never felt nervous or uncomfortable.  I had 2 interviewers  and they made it so easy. It was like speaking with team members. The process was also very quick, I was called 2 days after my interview with an offer.
Interview Questions: How would I deal with a difficult patient.

title: Desktop Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Hanford, CA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
It was a straight forward interview process. 
Greeted me, went ahead and asked several general questions.
Asked about my experience and education. 
Then I asked them several questions regarding the position.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths and weaknesses?
Give us an example of a challenge in your experience?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Fair and honest. Be open to learn new thing as floating will be common. The work environment is great everyone is friendly and open to answer any questions you may have
Interview Questions: Name three antipsychotics  and do you have experience

title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Jacksonville, FL) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: International visa sponsorship procedure.  Had pass clinical assessment interview  which took 3 weeks to get it scheduled and was told to get a second interview with hiring manager from the specific location. Been waited for this for 6 weeks.
Interview Questions: How did I describe myself?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews, one by the manager followed up by a peer interview. The first interview was more basic specialty questions. The second interview consisted of situational questions and was significantly more difficult.
Interview Questions:
Prevention of falls is of high importance. How would you contribute to the prevention of falls?

What are the side effects of antipsychotic medications?

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was initially contacted by HR via LinkedIn and we then had a phone conversation about the role and my qualifications. This was followed by an interview with my direct boss, interview with CEO, and finally a panel interview with  4 colleagues.
Interview Questions: Past experience, work samples, strengths and weaknesses, ability to work with others

title: Caregiver, CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Orlando, FL) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very rushed. Did not want to pay what you are worth. Seemed gf very cold during interview process. Heard gossiping in the hallway from other staff. Supervisor said they have a high turnover for their staffing. They don't stay long as soon as they get hired.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Silver Spring, MD) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: 3 people in management on a zoom interview but they didn’t turn on cameras. I had my camera on. The unit manager did most of the questioning. They were professional.
Interview Questions: Why I would like to work at Adventist.

title: ICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Received email for interview set up within 2 weeks of applying. Virtual interview, with 3 management personnel including director. Friendly interview, 20 minutes or so. Gave an opportunity to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Identifying sepsis and describing orders you would typically expect to be ordered.

title: RN ICU Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Very friendly, low key and informative via video call. The interview was scheduled by the recruiter with both the clinical manager and charge nurse...both were friendly and informative.
The position was for ICU at the Waterman location.
Interview Questions: General experience, some general situational but not the, "what would you do"...." tell me about an instance where you gave exceptional care" etc. that tend to leave me stammering and racking my brain for a specific instance. I think there are too many to recall specifically tbh.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: interview was via video call with 4 to 5 people from different unit. most of the questions were situational so be prepared to know basic pharm and nursing interventions. duration of the interview was around 15-20 mins.
Interview Questions:
Why this company?
Name a time you had a conflict with a coworker
Tell us about yourself
Where do you see yourself in 5 years
How would you deal with coworkers that are not following company policies

title: RN New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter reached out through phone call to confirm my interest and availability,  then schedule the interview sending a link to my email. I then interviewed with 1 nursing manager for about 40 mins via Microsoft teams. Waited for about a week to get the call back.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a medication administration mistake made by a coworker? Would you report it?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Visalia, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was simple and very organized. All interviews were via zoom or phone call. First interview was a phone call with the recruiter. Within a week a second interview was scheduled with the hiring manager. Shortly after the final interview was scheduled with the doctors.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work for a faith based organization?

title: Registered Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Orlando, FL) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Wonderful people. Probably one of the best interview experiences I've ever had. I began on November 1, 2021. I'm thrilled to be joining the Advent Health family. 
Wonderful people. Probably one of the best interview experiences I've ever had. I began on November 1, 2021. I'm thrilled to be joining the Advent Health family.
Interview Questions: How do I feel about them being a faith base organization?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: The supervisor I interviewed with was professional, encouraging and engaging with interviewee. Supervisors were very open and supportive of staff achieving personal goals. Interview was done virtually due to Covid. Overall great experience.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview was held via Google Meets. It was a panel style with about 5 different people (hiring managers, recruiters, etc). There were basic, situational and scenario questions. (The scenario questions were specific to the unit being interviewed for.)
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Adventist Health?

title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: called from management scheduled interview, waited for 15 mins from scheduled time, asked a few questions nothing pertaining to my resume or experience, what i wanted from the job, was shadowing another cma that was leaving and was telling me not great things, then taken back almost forgot about me, then a few more questions, then that was it i thanked her for her time and hoped to hear back soon. well i was not offered the job.
Interview Questions: Am i comfortable with manually taking vitals. which i responded with yes that was the only way we learned in school.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Fresno, CA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy to use online system. You read a question, have 30 seconds to prepare, and 3 minutes to record your answer for the question. It was my first interview so I was personally nervous but the questions are simple and straightforward. There was one question where they asked to give an example.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Video Interview through Microsoft Teams with unit manager and staff nurse. Interview lasted for about 30-45 minutes. Manager and Staff Nurse very nice and made me feel comfortable. We first talked about the job itself then the manager started to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Name a time you made a mistake and how would you do things differently?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Underwent an initial screening video that is self recorded and then a secondary interview with the hiring manager of the unit or location you are applying to. The interview process was easy.
Interview Questions: -Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Tampa, FL) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Fun very direct very nice interviewer they have a heart with the company very professional and you can tell they want you to make it. Very reasonable questions I am so thankful.
Interview Questions: If I work long hours how do I feel about it

title: Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: phone screening  then with the hiring manger and then with a panel of team members. Asked bunch of questions about my weakness and strengths. How I handle difficult situations.  Why I should get hired.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about yourself? Why do you want this job? What is your greatest strength? What is your weakness?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview, followed by an in person interview with the direct supervisor and team members. It was pretty straight forward. The whole team was nice and easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about the company’s values?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: interview question required 3 video and each video thing was 30 seconds it was fine but i was caught off guard sometimes.  not sure if i would prefer a real person or a video interview. i wish i was able to see what i responded afterwards but it gets automatically uploaded.
Interview Questions: dont know i just answered

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Portland, OR) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
This was at Adventist Health Portland OR.
Initial job screen was an automated video interview during which you were prompted with a question and you had 30 seconds to prepare your response and record your answer. 
The second interview was an interview with the unit manager one on one.
Interview Questions:
What is the hospitals mission? 
Tell me about yourself. 
Describe a difficult interaction with a coworker and how you handled it. 
How do you handle stress? 
Sell yourself for this position.

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Video Interview where you are given a question to answer, with 30 seconds to prep and then you are given 3 minutes to respond by videoing yourself. There are 3 questions and you have to record yourself answering all three.
Interview Questions: How are you going to uphold the mission of Adventist of Living God's love by inspiring health, wholeness and hope?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Honolulu, HI)
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed via video interview. I was given a link that took me to a virtual interview where different administrative individuals were recorded asking a question and I was given an opportunity to record myself giving my response.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you encountered a workplace conflict and how did you resolve that problem?

title: Consumer Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Video interview with hirevue , then face to face or virtual interview with managers due to covid it will likely be a virtual interview , then you will get a call from Hr with an offer if they selected you.
Interview Questions: The questions asked are situational

title: Activity Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Really simple and straight forward. Work around many different schedules had the basic interview questions and interviewer was understanding and easy to talk to. Many ask about availability because they need a lot of subs to fill in for the activity leaders
Interview Questions: Tell me about the time where are you encounter a challenge in the workplace?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions:
Dependent upon what you're interviewing for - make sure to review things pertinent to that unit. 
For example: Stepdown (SDU) - SDU titratable medications, ventilator settings, trach care. 
Telemetry (surgical/cardiac/pulmonary) - chest pain MONA, stroke, ekg review.

Goodluck & be confident!
Interview Questions: Sepsis criteria, chest pain (MONA), titratable medications (SDU/ICU)

title: CNA Med/Surg Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: During COVID-19 pandemic, interviews are being conducted over the phone. An offer was made separately from the interview. The interview process was a time for me to ask questions about the position and possible growth.
Interview Questions: The interview was more of an opportunity for me to ask questions about the position. Questions asked were about my work ethic and if I would be a good fit.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone Screening with recruiter, in person interview with hiring manager and then a team interview. After that I was invited to meet and greets with various key partners.  It was a great interview process and the recruiter was very transparent and helpful.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background and how it relates to this role.

title: Registered Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews. First with an RD and Director of nutrition services. 2nd with executive of patient care, HR, RD and chef. Ask a lot of technical questions about clinical RD position, behavioral questions, situational questions and past experiences.
Interview Questions: Explain how you would do a NFPE?

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was very pleasant and the panel was really nice. They started with a case study and then proceeded with behavioral questions. Then wrapped it up with questions you have for the panel
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Adventist White Memorial

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied and was quickly emailed for a phone interview. They asked some normal interview questions and then specific questions that had to do with being a CNA. Then I was moved onto the next stage, which was a "zoom" interview, which was more CNA based questions and situational questions. Everyone was super nice and the process was very smooth.
Interview Questions:
What are the vital signs and their normal ranges?

Charting

Fall prevention

title: New Graduate Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Very polite and friendly individuals that conduct the interviews. Also, provided proper information for the nurse residency program to help in determining if the program was a good fit. Also, the option to select from a variety of sites is a plus.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult patient scenario and how you handled it

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Redding, CA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Absolutely terrible depersonalized  video interview with yourself answering questions including discriminatory questions about “ god’s love”. A very uncomfortable process without the chance to talk to someone face to face. Awful.
Interview Questions: What’s it like to practice god’s love everyday?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Fresno, CA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview was through zoom, and that was an experience in itself. It lasted for about 20 minutes, the questions asked were generic interview questions. nonetheless I think the interview went well!
Interview Questions:
Q: so tell me about yourself
Q: what is your availability

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Sonora, CA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel of 5 people which included 4 RNs and the head of the nursing department. They all took turns asking me certain questions pertaining to my abilities, strengths, and personality. I had no prior CNA experience and they adjusted their questions according to what I should know.
Interview Questions: Where would you make sure to look out for pressure sores?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Timely screening process with recruiter; only 30 minutes with hiring manager and director and then silence. Nothing for weeks. They asked to check references and then still nothing. Pretty standard questions, although it was hard to build rapport over Zoom and also 30 minutes isn't enough to really tell a story. It would be fine if that was a screening call, but then to ask for my references made it seem like it was further in the process.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your background & experience

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview was through HireVue, it was a video interview one way. You have 30 seconds to prepare and 3 minutes to answer. I thought of the process to be easy to navigate but also nerve wrecking bc you have X amount of time to answer
Interview Questions: Why are you excited to work here

title: Talent Acquisition Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a 2 step interview process. A phone screen with the hiring manager and then with the team on Microsoft Teams. Great candidate experience. They were nice and transparent.
Interview Questions: Explain your recruitment process from start to finish

title: Senior Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Roseville, CA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Zoom meeting. The hiring manager had his face up on the screen the whole time giving me this intense seriuous look. He came accross like an overbearing jerk. I tried to stay light, and enthusiastic, but it was hard looking at someone who seemed angry.
Interview Questions: Typing speed, and previous experience.

title: Staff Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions and was basically hired through an agency first.  After awhile was observed and asked about my background and career goals.  Really calm interview and was relaxed.  Not too many questions
Interview Questions: Why did you want to work here

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Company utilized HireVue software to conduct online interview. Process was very straightforward and the software was easy to navigate. HireVue gives you opportunities to have practice questions first before starting the interview questions.
Interview Questions: They asked about why you were interested in the organization, how you would support the mission, and to describe an impossible task.

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed online via a program they use where you have to read the questions and answer the interview questions on video cam while it records and times you. A couple weeks later a recruiter called me and we discussed the units available. The recruiter then told me the GN  would not be assigned to a specific unit, and that we would be placed where needed.
Interview Questions: Something about how you will follow the mission and the core values of the hospital... I forgot, it was timed so fast. But there was only like 5 questions.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions:
Pandemic Covid Version. It was all virtual/phone call.
Received email from HR
Scheduled a phone interview with HR
Interview with dept manager and asst.  took a while because this was when some of the hospitals closed down except for emergent cases. I got a phone call from the manager and we did a phone interview and then I was
Hired
Interview Questions: What type of experience do you have

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Lodi, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Pre recorded questions and 2 minutes to record your answer.  You could watch while recording or black it out so you don't see your face.  There were 8 questions in all.
Interview Questions: Typical behavioral questions.  Were were some open ended ones like tell us about yourself and tell us something you would like us to know about you.  There was a great question about what you like and dislike about your last job.

title: Mental Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Kailua, HI) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions:
When I applied I went through a few steps.
The first step will ask you to do a video recorded interview through the app HireVue. This wasn't so bad but it definitely felt awkward because it was a one way interview that basically just recorded your answers.
About a couple days later I contacted the hospital with questions about what I have to do next because I never got an e-mail or phone call about next steps. I got contacted about doing an in-person interview about a week after I contacted them. The in-person interview was done over the HireVue app again due to the social distancing rules. I was the last interview for that position and right after the interview I was told that I would get contacted either that day or early the next week for on their decision for the position. Before the end of the call the interviewer kept trying to get me to apply to part time positions and positions that had me doing minimal to no work in departments that I wasn't interested in working in because they had heard that I was a student in college. I made it very clear that I am a very organized individual who have been working full time (40 hours a week) and attending college full time for two years before I applied to this job. The people interviewing me did not make me feel welcomed or wanted at all in this whole interview.
A week later and I haven't heard anything back from this hospital about the position at all. I reached out to the talent acquisition manager that set the interview appointment up for me and I was told that the decision is still pending but I should hear back within that week. Well, Friday comes around and I still haven't heard anything back again. So, I contact the talent acquisition person again and I still received the same answer as the week before.
Two weeks later I email the talent acquisition gentleman again and shortly after I finally received the email saying they're proceeding with a different candidate but didn't bother to call or give me a chance to ask questions or whatnot.
Overall I would rate this whole experience negatively because there was a huge lack of communication on the hospital's part. The interview wasn't difficult but the interviewers didn't seem to care about me or my interest in the position.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had to go against what management told you to do

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Lodi, CA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with the hiring manager, introduced to staff and given a tour of department. It felt casual, but once in the interview the questions were very intense and scenario case-based.
Interview Questions: Clinical based, scenario questions with pharmacology. Multiple questions, felt like a nursing school exam.

title: LD Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Hanford, CA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online on the company website, emailed the director I had applied. Did a zoom interview process. Did not get the job despite having more nursing experience than the people they hired.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be in LD

title: Nutrition Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: All personal questions. Asked to talk about myself, goals, and ambitions. Asked where I expect to be in five years. Ask if I wanted to grow within the company. It was like any other interview, no degree or experience needed.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your journey here.

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was short and to the point. They want to get a better understanding on who you are and how you'd fit the working environment you are being considered for.
Interview Questions: How does your experience prepare you for the job at hand?

title: RESPIRATORY Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Sacramento, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was very good. it was an online interivew so that made it a little bit awkward but overall i would say that i believe things went pretty well. thank you
Interview Questions: Tell me something intersting

title: ER Medical Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: It was very brief. Was interviewed for 10 minutes and hired on the spot. I was shown around the department and left there by myself. I met some other people in the department and was able to chat with the director.
Interview Questions: What do you like to do outside of work?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: A member of the AH Talent Acquisition team contacted me via my linkedin profile. I wasn't looking at the time - however, the nature of the work and role was intriguing. I listened, asked questions and we hung up after an intriguing conversation. Several months later they called again, we discussed the business a bit more and how their HR org was evolving along with the strategy. I accepted a phone interview, came in to interview in person with the hiring manager, and then had follow up interviews with leaders in the region. The process was smooth, I was well informed and the point of contact was responsive.
Interview Questions: AH uses typical behavioural questions: tell me about a time when ...

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: The first round was via Hirevue (digital interview)- just make sure to read the tips beforehand (find a quiet place, treat it like a real interview, ect.), and then an in-person interview with a panel.
Interview Questions: All behavioral based.

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Recorded online video interview with about 5 questions. About 1 min prep time for each question . There is a time limit for each question. The interview is recorded, so it is not like a skype interview where you can see the person interviewing you. The questions are automated.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Contacted/invited through email to do a preliminary video interview through HireVue and currently waiting to hear back on application status. Very standard, nothing surprising. You have practice questions beforehand where you can see how your video answers look, but you don't get to retake any video answers when you actually answer the interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Adventist Health?

title: Medical Records Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Hanford, CA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview and was asked a variety of basic interview type questions along with behavioral questions. Panel interview consisted of the director, office manager, and LVN. Friendly experience and made me comfortable.
Interview Questions: How would you handle conflict with a coworker?

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was about 30 minutes with the list of questions AdventHealth is required to ask you. The second interview was short and sweet. I immediately felt a great connection with everyone!
Interview Questions: What are some challenges you face at your current job, and how do you overcome them?

title: Chaplain Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Lodi, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I participated in a very unusual interview. It was via HireVue an app used by Adventist Health. I was given 8 questions to answer and 5 mins to answer each question. Before the general interview started the app allowed me several practice runs before answering each other. This practice feature also allow me to relax before comfortable with the camera. This was a very different experience for me and would recommend this type introductory interview approach to any employer looking to meet a potential employee.
Interview Questions: The first question centered on passed experiences relative to the position of hire and how I could contribute to the on going success of the company

title: MA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Hanford, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 3 provides and a few members of each of their team. Everyone was nice and seemed very interested. I love that they really try to make you feel comfortable during the interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a conflict at a previous job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Bakersfield, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was simple. Applied online and I was in contact with their recruiter. Went in for in person interview with most preferred three units department managers. I was asked the typical interview questions and some critical thinking scenarios. Received my offer in a timely manner. Was able to receive a lot of support to make sure it was a smooth transition. Highly recommend
Interview Questions: Strengths & weaknesses/ short and long term professional goals

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Ukiah, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I was referred to Ukiah by a friend because I was told they were desperate. I had 3 interviews, one in person, one by phone and one more in person with about 4 people. The communication was very lacking. I would get a last minute request for an interview, then the day of they would cancel “due to meetings. This happened twice. Very disrespectful of my time. Finally after my friend telling me how great things were going and 6 weeks post final interview, the manager sheepishly called my to tell me they didn’t have any positions to offer me.  They couldn’t even say something like, “It’s not a good fit.”  I felt completely lied to. Like I was being strung along. 
I have no interest in an organization that cannot be honest with me.
Interview Questions: What do you think would be difficult for you in learning to work in the emergency room?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Hanford, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: First they do a meet amd greet. Then if they like you,, they send you a link to record yourself answering a couple of questions. Then if you're chosen you go to a panel interview with about 6 people. Nerve wrecking  but they put you at ease. Then you have to complete a handwritten assessment. If
Interview Questions: What does integrity mean to you

title: Director of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Hanford, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Met with 3 senior managers that were extremely professional and kind.  They were easy to communicate with and seemed genuine.  Haven’t heard back yet but will remember how they made me feel during the process.
Interview Questions: Why are you the ideal candidate

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Orlando, FL)
Interview Descriptions: They called me on a Friday, for an interview on Monday. The interview was informative and encouraging. We went over typical interview questions, but also goals. We discussed long term plans, and how the job can benefit me, and Vice versa.
Interview Questions: How well organized are you (scale 1-10)

title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied to the job on the company's website and 1 week later received a call from the recruiter. She asked me about my experience and why I wanted to work at Glendale, then she gave me some details about the department and invited me for an interview with the manager. The job interview was sort of informal, with only the nurse educator and a nursing supervisor, in addition to the manager. It lasted less than 30 minutes, and concluded by giving me a tour around the department.
Interview Questions: Tell me how would you care for a patient that checks in with fever, tachycardia, hypotension and flank pain.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Ukiah, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Me, the department head, and one other sat in an office. It was a standard interview with personality type Q & A with skillset questions mixed in. It last approximately one hour.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you made a mistake and what you did afterwards.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Be prepared to answer basic questions that relate to your specialty. Also, how do you resolve conflict, what are your strengths and weaknesses, where do you see yourself in 5 years, and the like.
Interview Questions: Same as above... How do you resolve conflict? Strength and weaknesses Where will you be in 5 years? But really be prepared to answer basic questions relating to your specialty.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was fast, easy and not overwhelming. Interviewer was nice and offered other open jobs. They give you the job on the spot or a couple days to call back.
Interview Questions: What are the vital signs

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Ocala, FL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Online, questionnaire. Then an online personality survey, then phone interview. From the time of the posting until the interview, it was three weeks. There was no personal face to face time.
Interview Questions: About management skills.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: I received an email from Adventist Health to complete a video interview. HireVue, the app for the video interview, was unique to me because I have never heard of this before. The video interview included 4 general questions and allowed me 3 minutes to answer it.
Interview Questions: 1. Why do you want to work for Adventist health?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Application for the position was submitted online. About one week later I received and email invitation to complete web based recorder interview. Few practice questions were offered to help to be familiar with the format of web-recorder interview.  During the practice questions up to 30 seconds were allotted to prepare the answer. However, during actual interview questions, those 30 seconds were not given.
Interview Questions: Explain why your background and experience would be a good fit for this job.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Video interview invitations was sent by email. They have 4 practice questions and you can do it as many as you like. There are 3-4 interview questions and you have 30 secs to think about on each question. Once your answer was recoreded you can’t redo.
Interview Questions: Why Adventist health? Name a time you had to make a difficult decision

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Brief, very friendly and straight to the point. 3 interviewers took turns asking questions. They were really nice, and even laughed with me at times. Explained the hiring process as well.
Interview Questions: How many days in a year have you missed aside from personal illness?

title: HR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: I have never in my life been on an interview where I have been asked up front if I was ok if Jesus was invoked as part of prayer at every meeting. Frankly, I am still checking to see if that's legal. While I believe in god and prayer, in the work place, if this is indeed legal it should be non-denominational
Interview Questions: Are you ok if we pray in Jesus' name at meetings?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy- I got an interview, interviewed within the next two days, heard that day that I was chosen for the job. Accepted the position that night and started the next month.
Interview Questions: How do you spend your free time

title: HR Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Bakersfield, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a short process. Overall a positive experience. I was contacted by a recruiter and interviewed 4 days later. It was a panel interview with 4 human resource employees.
Interview Questions: How do you perform when tasks come up unexpectedly and throw off your routine?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: I came for the walk-in Wednesday, and the interview process was very smooth and professional.  The talent acquisition agent (Andrew) helped prepare me for the interview and arranged one for me in under an hour.   The nurse managers were very friendly and helped me feel comfortable throughout the entire process. I enjoyed the interview process and I can tell they really care about their employees. I can't wait to start work soon :)
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, and why you want to work at this hospital?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Marysville, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: A nurse recruiter called to setup an interview by phone and setup a time for the following week. The nurse manager and a staff nurse conducted the interview which lasted about half an hour. I got a call about a week and a half later with a job offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at rideout?

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Rockville, MD) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very thorough. The team asked many thoughtful questions. They were eager to share their experiences at Adventist.  They were warm and inviting while still directing an insightful discussion into their work environment and how I might fit in.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a time you had to step outside of your comfort zone to get the job done.

title: Project Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Delightful!  From the moment I walked in, I could tell the team was kind and professional and sometimes that is hard to find!  I felt welcomed right away and look forward to going back!
Interview Questions: What type of people do you like working with?

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were very Friendly.  They spent a lot of time focusing on my career goals and what I was looking for.  They were thorough in describing the history of the organization and work expectations.  Excellent experience and a good match.
Interview Questions: What my career goals were?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health (Ukiah, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Two weeks later a Talent Advisor contacted me via email to have my references fill out a survey. That was the last I heard from anyone there. 2 months later I withdrew my application.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with Director, Manager and Charge nurse. Answered series of questions about case examples and my own experience, reason for choosing nursing. Very friendly and professional interviewers. Had the opportunity to ask questions as well.
Interview Questions: Scenario questions

title: Multiple Positions Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a typical panel review conducted in person. The interviewing process was very nice and the staff are very friendly before and during your arrival. Most of my expenses traveling were paid for and I was supposed to be reimbursed for what I did spend. However, I tried contacting HR several times and have not received any replies, updates on my candidacy, or a reimbursement for my expenses.
Interview Questions: What are your hobbies?

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Ukiah, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview, invited to interview in person. Arrived ten minutes early to a haphazardly organized pharmacy. One pharmacist and one technician had called out. I was handed over to the other technicians who had me shadow them. Finally able to interview, it was conducted by the technicians. The pharmacist said she was listening. Pharmacist ordering baked goods during interview seemed more important to her than filling the position. Was told at the end of this odyssey, that I would receive a phone call one way or the other, in a week. After ten days, no phone call. I contacted HR via the toll free number. Woman who answered was very kind but had the attitude, that I should know what's up if they've ghosted me. She took my information and said someone from the recruiting team would be emailing me. Four days later, no email, either. 

I feel that they are only going through the motions for HR and not really looking to hire anyone. My suspicion is they're not hiring to ensure the other technicians get fulltime/overtime.

I may not be a doctor or pharmacist but I am still an educated and trained professional. I've been treated with more respect interviewing for counter help at an ice cream store. 

Skip Adventist. You'll thank yourself later.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a patient or nurse demanding narcotics?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Began with a tour of the pharmacy. It was then followed by a timed assessment to test technician knowledge. Interviewed with the pharmacist but it seemed like they didn't know that the interview was scheduled. Questions weren't really structured.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a pharmacy technician?

title: Regional Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had two phone interviews, one with recruiter, and one with the Director of Finance (my direct manager).  Both of which were standard interviews with basic questions about my background, skills, and situational experiences.
Interview Questions: What is the process for creating a budget?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Rockville, MD) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a phone interview.  That was followed by a face-to-face interview.  The third interview was also face-to-face with an executive.  The final interview was a face-to-face group interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Urgent Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted by a recruiter, where I had a phone interview.  I was then invited for an in-person interview at the site where I interviewed with one manager who was on site and another via skype.  After the in-person interview, I was invited for a second in-person interview where the previous skype manager would be in person.  I was also sent an email where I had to include 5 references that were required to complete an electronic survey about me.  I declined the second interview, as I realized the workplace probably wasn't the best fit for me.  Although the staff seemed mostly friendly, the workplace seemed pretty strict and conservative (for example, I overheard a conversation where a receptionist was scolded for having her phone on the desk even though she was just quickly using it to copy an address over to the computer)
Interview Questions: "Why do you think you would be a good fit for this position", and other relatively standard interview questions, as well as some religious questions that seemed a little unusual.  I was asked a few questions like: how do I feel about prayer in the workplace, etc.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application and followed the process online. Then I was called in for an interview with team. It was a very standard process and professional interview. I was told what the timeline was and kept very in the loop.
Interview Questions: What is your plan in this position?

title: RN Operating Room Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had multiple phone interviews with their Human Resource department and got scheduled a week later for a final interview with the Operating Room Surgeon I'd be working initially working with.
Interview Questions: Will you refrain from watching Korean dramas so you English can improve?

title: Medical Chart Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Tampa, FL) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The Interview process was well managed. There was great organization/ communication between HR Shared Services and the Department/Hiring Managers. And a nice line of communication was provided for the candidate to contact either of them with any questions or additional info post-interview.
Interview Questions: To give an example of a challenging situation faced in a job and give brief explanation of how you worked through/ resolved it.

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward interview. I felt comfortable and felt that I was being listened to when I was speaking. We sat down in a conference room and spoke one on one with one another.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was interviews by two people. Once the interview ended I got a call from the director and offered me a full time position. He informed me of the process and how it was going to happen
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Jacksonville, FL) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Organized, professional and relevant.  It was not explained ahead of time what was expected and during the application/interest phase, it appeared to be a 'job fair' style of meeting.
Interview Questions: Length of service.  Work history.  Brief overview of CV/resume.  Position and hours requested.  Ability to work weekends or nights.

title: Support Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I had a prescreening phone interview, was given an interview questionnaire that provided the employer with my strengths and weaknesses and was then granted an in person interview with the hiring director.
Interview Questions: Describe an accomplishment.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Ukiah, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy and not very meaningful.  They violated several standards they stated they stood for in the interview after hiring was completed.  Watch out for this group.  Low ethical standards and high turnover due to micromanaging CEO.  Watch out for this organization.  Not much improvement even after departure.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone call interview is 30 minutes long, critical, and intense. Clinical questions and why questions. Which units and why? Why GAMC? Why nursing? Etc. How many Clinical hours in preferred unit?
Interview Questions: What have you been doing since graduation?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: easy and fast, phone, followed by in-person interviews, second interviews, and even third interviews. In addition to a hiring manager, you make meet with managers, employees, and other .took 23 days
Interview Questions: very general behavioral type of questions. What’s your greatest weakness? 6.	Where do you see yourself in five years

title: Claims Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Roseville, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by 2 people who asked general questions regarding the claim process and my responsibilities as an Investigative Asst within Risk Mgmt. offered me the position a few days later, but deglected to tell me the position was more of a file clerk job
Interview Questions: What is your main function in your current position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email three weeks later. Had an interview via email it was forty minutes long and after  I had to fill out a survey relating to the interview process.
Interview Questions: What is a strength of mine?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions:
1st interview was a panel interview with 5 staff members (recruiters, nurse educator and new grad program coordinator).  Some basic questions to let them know your personality, situational questions (what would you do?) and critical thinking.
2nd interview is with the unit managers
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at this hospital? How do you demonstrate some of our companies core values?

title: Onboarding Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: three separate interviews- was hired within a month. Not a difficult interview.  There was no job description which made it difficult to fully understand what I was hired for. No drug test needed.
Interview Questions: what is your worst quality?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Paradise, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through their electronic system, received a phone call from an employee in HR about 3 weeks later to set up an interview time. After the interview, I received an email about a week later to submit information about 5 references.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to deal with a problem and how you solved it

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was asked a series of questions on the computer. Each question I was to record myself answering it. I had no knowledge of what the questions would be and was timed on my answers. I found it difficult as I didn't have another person to speak with to gauge on how my answers were going.
Interview Questions: Do you have any weaknesses?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Very lengthy and slow process. Had 4 separate interviews on different days and met with 9 individuals over a 6 week period. 2 phone interviews and 2 in person panel interviews. Nothing out of the ordinary typical interview questions. For a staff level position with no leadership or management duties I felt the process was overkill. They 100% over interviewed. I met with 1 Regional Manager,  4 Directors, 2 Managers and 2 staff individuals. I went from highly interested in the beginning of the process to completely turned off due to slow and lengthy process.
Interview Questions: Career goals. why healthcare. past processes. tools used to do the job. challenging situation.

title: IT Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Adventist Health in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Received an e-mail with a link to website where I was asked questions and had to give a video response.  If you click back before the time is over, the video will not be saved and you can try it again. When you're done recording your response, you can submit it and move on. You must be in a well-lit, distraction-free environment and dress professionally.
Interview Questions: Give one example of a time that you made a positive impact on someone's life.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was a very positive overall experience. I met with nurse manager as well as the talent recruiter.
