They both are very happy , nice, and passionate people looking for the best to be out on their hospital floors. I love my current manager. Whenever I need anything she is a text away and she is always willing to answer any requests that I have.
Interview Questions: What work have you done in hospitals in the past? What is current job like, and how do you believe it has benefitted you to be able to work in this hospital?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Paradise, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. In person interview with director and managers. Offer pending drug testing. Basic history questions, none situational.  Nice people. Very slow Human Resources department. I applied to many positions before getting one call back for interview.
Interview Questions: Why work here?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Roseville, CA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online in June 2016 and got a phone interview with HR and the hiring manager in September. After inviting me for an on-site interview during the phone call, I didn't hear anything from HR or the manager.

In November, I got an e-mail from HR, telling me that they are still interested and flew out in December. I had a day-long interview to speak to various executives.  There was no fixed schedule or structured questions. One interviewer rushed out the door right when I entered.

About 10 days later, they asked for 5 references, which I submitted. I got an e-mail telling me my references were good but that they are still unsure whether they are going to fill the position. Almost 2 months later, and after no communication whatsoever from anyone, I learned that they were still uncommitted to hiring for the position.
Interview Questions: How would the election change the payor mix?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a interview and hiring process was good experience overall. The on-boarding process was easy. HR was very responsive.  They do close very early on Friday--so beware if you have any questions and try to call before the weekend, the phone will not be answered.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Portland, OR) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and then about 1 week later I was called in for an interview.  The interview was with the supervisor and the director of the office. They asked me personality trait questions, why I was leaving my current role, and asked me specifics from my application and resume. By the end of the interview we were laughing and chatting. They took me on a tour too. About 2 days later I received the offer.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time when you had to work with someone who was being difficult.

title: New Grad RN Med/Surg Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Hanford, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 4 nurses and 1 HR representative. They had a list of personality questions, as well as 3 clinical type questions. They were extremely casual, warm, and welcoming. They were honest and upfront about their expectations, and obviously very proud of Hanfod Medical center. It was the best interview I have experienced thus far and since the cohort starts so soon they offered me the job on the spot!
Interview Questions: When have you gone above and beyond? How do you feel about working in a religious hospital? When have you had to deal with a stressful situation?

title: New Grad Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Honolulu, HI) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied to a New Grad RN position that was posted on the website. It took a few weeks but I was contacted via email to complete an online critical thinking test. Once that was completed I was called to set up an interview. I interviewed with the HR recruiter as well as the unit manager and department head. I felt like the interview went well, it took about an hour and was asked the typical interview questions as well as scenario questions. It was like a board interview where they each asked questions. I did not get an offer for the position and was told it was because they like to hire from within. So my advice before going through the motions would be to ask HR those questions ahead of time before you get your hopes up of getting hired in Hawaii. This is a great hospital in a great community, just really hard to get your foot in the door. They advise to work as a tech prior to RN but to me that is underutilizing me and my abilities.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Castle?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: First of all they do Phone interview with a recruiter. After you pass the phone ipscreen, they do group interview with a nursing manager, a director, a charge nurse, an educator. And then HR goes through the background check and physical examination
Interview Questions: ACL questions. Previous work experience

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Saint Helena, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an online application and then followed up in person with Human Resources a few weeks later after not hearing back. From there I was given an interview with the head nurse. It took a few weeks before I was given a final offer and another month before I actually began due to a 3 day HR training and other paperwork I needed to fill out. The interview lasted about 20 minutes and I was asked routine interview questions like "tell me about yourself: Everyone I encountered here in HR and for my interview were very friendly and welcoming.
Interview Questions: What is one conflict you have had in the workplace?

title: Outpatient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the position, a week later I called to follow up and they said if they are interested they will call you. A week later I got a screen call asking to come in to take a test and if I was interested in the position. After taking the test, they scheduled an interview the following week. After being interviewed I got a call 2 days later with the job offer.
Interview Questions: My experience and knowledge with medical terminology

title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very informal interview process, one of the interviewers came in late. They have a panel (mostly supervisors) that would ask you a lot of technical questions. It felt like I was in a game show, to be honest. The panel makes faces, give each other weird looks whenever I didn't satisfy their questions. Lasted about 30mins. After the interview, the director offered me a tour around the workplace.
Interview Questions: How long am I willing to stay with them (I guess they have high turnover rates).

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Well processed and organized. From the initial contact the program exudes professionalism, good positive energy, genuine caring and interest for the staff, students, as well as patients. Not commonly found in big facilities.  They took care of you for lunch time, there is a fantastic cafeteria and we had fresh fruit available. I had a great time dreaming it would be my place of work. On the 5th floor - one can see the ever famous Hollywood sign. The area seems safe, the local people friendly, the clinic adjacent to the hospital - all inclusive and well oiled and running machine. Most impressive.
Interview Questions: They were interested in me, who I was as a person. My path to arrive to my decisions, how I was viewed by my peers. I felt they were getting a feel for the just right member for the team. That is encouraging - when they look after their own.

title: Talent Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Roseville, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two step interview. The company talks about values and mission a lot so make sure you know what the company is about. Be yourself and express why you would love the position you are applying for.
Interview Questions: Values and Mission of company

title: RN New Grad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: After the online application I was sent a link with 111 personality questions, 5 math problems and 5 reading comprehension questions. Mostly basic stuff for math except some triangle algebra question and the writing style for the passage.
Interview Questions: Do you pride yourself in taking care of your friends or family who are in need? Never, sometimes, often or always?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was quick 15 mins , everyone was very nice and helpful..talked to the mangers..not very difficult it was quick 15 mins , everyone was very nice and helpful..talked to the mangers..not very difficult
Interview Questions: let me about your self

title: Patient Admit Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Did 1st and 2nd interview on the spot. General questions. Very positive and warm vibe! Immediatley felt welcomed. Interviewed infront of 3 and then infront of 2. Got offered position on the spot.
Interview Questions: why should we hire you? whats your weakness

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: it was good. the hiring manager was so approachable. She interviewed me about behavior on how to handle conflict at work and some stuffs. it took me 30 minutes for the interview. after the interview, she gave me a tour of the unit.
Interview Questions: behavior

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Boyle Heights, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very hard interviews. 2 panel interviews of 6 people in two different days. Clinical and behavioral questions. You don't need to study. Most of the time they are evaluating how you think critically. There is a medication test as a filter before the interview. I guess this is the way to weed out " the not so good candidates". If you did not struggle with math in your nursing school, the test is ok.
Interview Questions: Behavioral and clinical questions.

title: RN - CITU Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the recruiter that led to a panel interview with the telemetry director and two telemetry unit managers. It was difficult to contact the recruiter and I often had trouble reaching her. She didn't call me for the scheduled telephone interview and we ended up rescheduling multiple times.
Interview Questions: Can you name the core measures for acute myocardial infarction?

title: ER Admitting Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Fresno, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: ER admitting Supervisor does the interview and another clerk taking notes of ur answer. After a series of questions you are ask to take a basic common hospital work vocabulary test!!
Interview Questions: What would you do if the computer screen freeze?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: interview process: received email confirming my interest for the position, and then had first on-site interview with the manager.  Had typical questions regarding previous employment.  Second interview was with other staff members (group interview) to assess if I would be a good fit for the department.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: 3-4 panel interview, questions are straight forward, one clinical question and the rest are 'describe me a time when.' Called about 30 minutes after the interview was over and was offered a position, went to employee health the next week for physical and immunizations and began working the next week after.
Interview Questions: Tell me how you would respond to a confrontational corworker or physician

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: They hire anyone. It used to be a great place with talented people, but they started hiring sleezeballs who have either suspended and/or questionable nursing skills because they can pay them next to nothing. Noone else will hire them!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Sonora, CA)
Interview Descriptions: very pleasant interview. I had to complete a few computer learning classes and testing. Compliance classes, went over handbook issues.  Trained by another CNA FOR 3-5 days before I was on floor alone. Then trained with a Rn for 3 days also.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied about a week prior to call back.  One interview with a panel.  I was asked for references by the end of the day.  Offered the next day.  Background check started online the next day.  Overall very very quick.
Interview Questions: What is your ideal specialty and why?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview followed by two in person interviews. They asked a lot of technical questions that I didn't know the answers to, but they hired me anyway. It seems like they aren't really sure what to ask during an interview, since my answers did not support me being a knowledgeable nurse for them. None of the questions were negative (like "What's your greatest weakness?"), so at least there wasn't that type of stuff to deal with.
Interview Questions: Pathway from femoral artery to heart

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I sat down with the Director, an Assistant, and two Staff Pharmacist for a formal interview lasting approximately 30 minutes.  Most questions were scenario based from pre-determined set  witha few clinical questions.
Interview Questions: If you could ask one question, what would it be and why?

title: Ultrasound Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
easy but complicated  .......they didnt mention that day only want Ardms on application ,i have RVT and they didnt like that :0 
but overal they were nice 
the interview was so formal
Interview Questions: about experience

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview.  Dress professional.  Be prepared.  Be yourself.  Emphasize team work. HR person will be in the interview, along with the Director, unit manager and one to two floor nurses.  They will all ask questions.
Interview Questions: Why nursing?

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Adventist Health (East Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was not professional.  The interviewer lacked professionalism and knowledge of the position.  Was unable to answer many of my questions.  Did not feel it was worth my time going forward, since I did not see a professional connection from the interviewer.  

There was no clear difinitiion on what he is looking for in an individual for this position.  The interviewer was quirky and seemed like  he had some type of superiority complex.  Very surprised to see this from a religious based organization!  Did not get any follow up call or update on the status of my interview.
Interview Questions: Education question: If my Master degree was on-line or on campus.  Don't know why this would matter and why the interviewer needed to know.  The position. I applied for only requests a bachelor degree.

title: Patient AC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Selma, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The first interview went well, they ask the standard interview questions. The manager and lead were in the interview, I took a math test, english/spelling test, basic terms for hospital setting.
Interview Questions: What are my strengths and weakness?

title: Business Intelligence Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Reviewed the project they asked to finished before. I think I failed at this part since I did not review the report I made which is five days ago. And it's better to practice making presentation to customers with the project you did before the interview.

It's a Panel Interview with 5 people. They all very nice, and asked question gently, except one or two pressure question like what's your biggest weakness.
Interview Questions: Do you like facing customers?

title: Insurance Claims Data Entry Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Roseville, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and comfortable interview.  I was referred to company through staffing agency. They were able to set up interview right away for me. Job duties and expectations were explained very well and I was given opportunity to ask questions also
Interview Questions: Tell us why you are interested in being considered for this position?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Saint Helena, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with hiring director prior to final approval for position. I had initial interview before the position description was finalized. After about a month of waiting, the position description was finalized and I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with process improvement?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Very brief and the interviewer was practically in a rush. I met with the nurse manager for that particular floor. We were constantly being interrupted and just felt unprofessional/rude.  I have not once been to an interview that was complete lack of respect for others and making a possible new employee feel welcomed and included. I felt like it an inconvience. It lasted about 15 minutes and  hats stretching it. The manager had a meeting right away and flew out the door.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have and how would that benefit the floor your being hired for?

title: Volunteer Department Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Contacted via email by recruiter. Had quick 5 minute phone screen. Asked to come in to take very basic clerical tests. Invited for in-person interview. Interviewed with Program Coordinator and Director of the Volunteer Dept. The interview was pretty casual. They both had a packet of questions, but didn't ask every single question-- rather, selected a few and asked some questions of their own. Though I didn't feel like I aced the interview, I thought I did well enough; to my surprise, I didn't get an offer. I believe I was pretty qualified (as this is a basic admin position) and presented myself well. Irrelevant interview tip: Parking is insanely expensive ($6.50 flat after some minutes. I don't remember exactly). Try to get validation where available in certain departments or if lucky, park outside along the curb.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself.
Tell us about a time when you had a disagreement with a co-worker/teammate/colleague and what you did to resolve the issue.
Are you comfortable with answering the phone?/What is your experience with talking on the phone?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
(All very standard questions you would encounter in any interview)

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Hanford, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Video interview after you submitted the applications. The video interview consists of math and nursing questions. Has 30 questions. Take at least an 45 minutes to complete. Make sure you have good wifi. Panel interview with 7-8 mangers. They ask you general questions, nursing multiple choices questions such as what do you do first or next.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: New Grad RN Med/Surg Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Hanford, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: applied online and got a call back from HR department a week after, video interview (had math questions at the end) - took around 45 mins, interview with all of med/surg department managers, HR rep, and director (took about 1 hour for me), then tour around the floor
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths/weaknesses? How did you handle a difficult situation? Tell us about your previous employer, Clinical-based and personality-based questions.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Precise, full of information about the company and how it runs. Described what they are looking for in the position I have applied for. The goal of the company.
Interview Questions: Why did you seek interest in our hospital?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed on the phone with the director. Asked a lot about previous experience and why you want to work for White Memorial Medical Center. Nothing out of the ordinary. Many of the questions were this or that. I did not run into any situation questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Clinical Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: Fantastic and really smooth process, facilities are nice and they ask pretty relevant questions.
Interview Questions: Tools used to perform job duties

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter called me the same day I emailed my application and cover letter. I was asked some initial questions by the recruiter, then she set up a time for a group interview a couple weeks later.  I had a group interview with 4 people. I was asked to elaborate on my previous experiences in other positions.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with difficult families?

title: NSA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Roseville, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: calls. in person. group. questions. talking. describing. explaining. random questions. phone interviews. one on one. technology questions. it was a long time ago. i liked the people. got the job offer and took it.
Interview Questions: how do you keep up with current technologies.

title: Applications Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Roseville, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview set up through Avanti (headhunters) went well. I had more questions than they did. The interview was very laid back though I have heard others had panel interviews with the director.
Interview Questions: How do I feel about praying at meetings

title: Grants Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: All has to go through HR. You may be interviewed by a panel of people who may or may not know anything about your background
Interview Questions: We are a christian institution. Do you believe in prayer?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Portland, OR) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Four total interviews of varying styles for a position in the New Graduate Nurse Residency program. It took approximately eight weeks, but they did have a few hundred applications to go through for fifteen positions.
Interview Questions: Tell us how you feel about our mission and values

title: Wellness Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Kailua, HI) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I met with the department director at the time and did two separate interviews, one with the director and the second one with the director and associate. It was a very relaxed and comfortable environment. Everyone in the department was friendly, and I enjoyed going through the interview process very much.
Interview Questions: Would you be comfortable facilitating groups?

title: PC Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Hanford, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Online application then after that you will get a call for first interview then if you go past that you get a panel interview then TB testing and physical and youre hired!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lab Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Simi Valley, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Opportunity presented by an associate who recommended me for this new position.  Met with project manager for new program twice, both informal. Was prepped and primed by my associate. Had one on one interview with director and come to find out, I was being interviewed for a completely different position.  Was blind-sided by the sudden shift in job description. One on one interview was about an hour long - the director read the interview questions off a standard questionnaire from their HR dept.  

I was very disappointed with the confusion, however I did not indicate that I was disappointed or confused. The project manager who was charged to spearhead this new unit and position consistently failed to respond to phone calls or text messages unless urged by my associate.  

VERY disappointed in the follow through of an upper management person - charged to spearhead a new unit who can't even acknowledge an email receipt.  Its no wonder the corporation is having financial difficulty and organizational challenges.
Interview Questions: describe a time when.....

title: Allied Health Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Orlando, FL) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: multiple managers and staff hammering questions. process was very long. I wasnt sure who exactly was the negotiating person. professional appearance a must!!! clean shaven, no tattoos visible, no open toe shoes, no excessive make up or jewelry
Interview Questions: mission statement

title: Healthcare Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: This consisted of a telephone pre-interview, then a face to face with 2 people, 1 person and I came back again to meet with another supervisor. All of the people were very friendly, and didn't ask anything too hard.
Interview Questions: Tell me something negative about yourself.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Portland, OR) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Was Fairly normal, they asked the normal interview questions. explained job description and expertise. What could i bring to the company, how could I pass my knowledge to other. I have much knowledge in patient flow, very efficient in blood draws, lab collections, All aspects of back office and front office duties, terminology and coding, Rx refills, and much more expertise Iknow.
Interview Questions: what can i bring to the company, , am I a  positive asset, ect....

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Hanford, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with this hospital. It was very nice experience for me, though I did not get a job offer. Everybody in panel made me feel so comfortable during an interview. Since I drove from San Francisco, they toured me their other two hospitals. The whole process took about 3 hours. After a week, interviewer called me and said she found someone with more experience, but I found very professorial to call me and inform. These days nobody cares to even send you a rejection email. If I get a chance, I would really love to work for them.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: New Graduate RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: For the new grad RN/versant program interview it started with an email questionnaire.  After you pass that stage then there is telephone interview with the RN recruiter. After that there was panel interview with the Versant coordinator and two RN recruiters. Finally, after the panel interview they will call to schedule a 1:1 interview with unit manager(s). I was scheduled to interview with 3 units but was offered a position for my 1st choice so I did not need to interview with the other two.
Interview Questions: What qualities make you an asset to the White Memorial family?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Glendale, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I took the initiative to call, and call when the appropraite amount of time had gone by. I made sure to let the HR know that I was very interested.
Interview Questions: If you could describe yourself in one word, what is that word and why?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Good and straight forward. Found the job on a jobs page, applied online. Received a call within a week to arrange an in-person interview. Interviewed with the main boss, then with a panel. Got a call with an offer in a little over one week. Interviews were easy. Just come prepared.
Interview Questions: No gotchas. Come prepared.

title: Systems Administrator Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adventist Health (Roseville, CA) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: They ask you basic questions such as: Why do you want to leave your current company, work experience, worst mistake you ever made, one of your greatest achievements, how do you deal with difficult situations in the workplace, etc
Interview Questions: N/A
